intro: Eranthemum hirtipistillum, commonly known as the woolly eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, or hirsute, foliage and stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers a humid, tropical climate. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
